mypackage

Class MyEditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • mypackage.MyEditor

  • public class MyEditor
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class of the program.

    Some of the operations of this class are:

    1. It handles any user interaction

    2. It creates Tuples using lines

    3. It saves any changes to the file

    4. It creates binary index files

    5. It searches for a word using serial or binary searches

    Author:
    Georgios Frangias

      This method conducts a binary search in the text

      • saveModifiedFile

        public void saveModifiedFile(DLL dll,
                             java.lang.String fn)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used to save the already modified text from the text editor overwriting the existing text file
        Parameters:
        dll - the doubly linked list used in the text editor
        fn - the path of the text file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createNewTuplesFromLine

        public void createNewTuplesFromLine(java.util.List<Tuple> tl,
                                    java.lang.String line,
                                    int lineNum)
        This method converts words from one line of the text to tuples and append them in the list of tuples

        It is called by the method addTuplesToTheList

        Parameters:
        tl - the list of tuples
        line - the line which needs to be converted to tuples
        lineNum - the number of the line in the text

      • addTuplesToTheList

        public void addTuplesToTheList(java.util.List<Tuple> tl,
                               DLL dll)
        This method converts all the words of the text to tuples and appends them in the list of tuples

        For every line of the file it calls the method createNewTuplesFromLine

        Parameters:
        tl - the list of tuples
        dll - the doubly linked list used in the text editor

      • createIndexFile

        public void createIndexFile(java.util.List<Tuple> tl,
                            java.lang.String fn)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method creates (or updates if it already exists) the index file of the text file in the same directory

        This is done page by page

        Parameters:
        tl - the list of tuples
        fn - the path of the text file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • printTuplesList

        This method prints the whole list of tuples
        Parameters:
        tl - the list of tuples

                         java.lang.String search)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method conducts a non-exhaustive serial search in the text
        Parameters:
        fn - the path of the text file
        search - the given word for search

        java.io.IOException

      • printResult

        public void printResult(int discAccesses,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> linesFound,
                        java.lang.String search)
        This method prints the results of a search conducted by the methods serialSearch or binarySearch
        Parameters:
        discAccesses - the number of disc accesses conducted by the search methods
        linesFound - the list of integers with the number of lines where the searched word was found
        search - the given word for search
